verblex: 1. To go and get something or someone and bring them to where you are. English = fetch, collect.
2. To pay money to use something for a period of time. English = hire.
nomlex: 1. A substantial sum of money that you get, receive or collect at one time, such as a superannuation payout, a redundancy package, or an inheritance.
2. An amount of money that is paid as a large amount on a single occasion rather than as smaller amounts on several separate occasions. English = lump sum.
